turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: It's kind of embarrassing but,

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: I had a dream about this place.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Oh boy.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: You see what I mean...

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Okay, so you had a dream about this place. Tell me.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Well ... it's the second one I've had, but they were both the same......they start out that I'm in here but it's not day or night. It's kinda half night, but it looks just like this except for the light, but I'm scared like I can't tell ya. Of all people you're standing right over there by that counter. You're in both dreams and you're scared. I get even more frightened when I see how afraid you are and then I realize what it is - there's a man...in back of this place. He's the one ... he's the one that's doing it. I can see him through the wall. I can see his face and I hope I never see that face ever outside a dream.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: So, you came to see if he's out there?

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: To get rid of this god-awful feeling.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Right then.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HARRY MCKNIGHT
turns.text: You feel it?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE NEAL DOMGAARD
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE NEAL DOMGAARD
turns.text: Sammy thinks the Caddy had stopped along the shoulder ... man up the road said he saw two cars drag racin'...then you got that blind corner.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HARRY MCKNIGHT
turns.text: Two men... two guns in the Caddy.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE NEAL DOMGAARD
turns.text: The boys found this on the floor in back of the Caddy.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HARRY MCKNIGHT
turns.text: Yeah, they showed me

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE NEAL DOMGAARD
turns.text: Could be unrelated.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HARRY MCKNIGHT
turns.text: Could be...any of those dead kids wearin' pearl earrings?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE NEAL DOMGAARD
turns.text: No. Could be someone's missin' maybe.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HARRY MCKNIGHT
turns.text: That's what I'm thinkin'.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HARRY MCKNIGHT
turns.text: Nice wallets.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE NEAL DOMGAARD
turns.text: Handstitched Italian. Filled with phony credit cards ... off the two guys in the Caddy.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HARRY MCKNIGHT
turns.text: The one of 'em still alive?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE NEAL DOMGAARD
turns.text: Yeah... just .... Dr. Scott's got 'im. You remember Dr.Scott.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HARRY MCKNIGHT
turns.text: Oh yeah.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE NEAL DOMGAARD
turns.text: Well he said...  you know in his way... you know what I mean? Besides the guy gettin' rolled up under the kids car which busted him up pretty bad, there was this little knife-like torn piece of metal, you know, off the car body, rolled out and slid up through this guy's neck and just kinda slit his aorta, you know, but they didn't find it right away, so the guy's losin' a lot of blood, you know, to the brain - all this time cause it was just like this thin little puncture wound on the surface of his neck that kinda sealed itself, he said, while inside the aorta is bleedin' pretty steady all that time. So, Dr. Scott's laughin' you know like he does 'cause he knows we want to talk to this guy. He's laughin' you know and shakin'... Son of a bitch couldn't stop laughin'... It was kinda contagious 'cause pretty soon we were all laughin'...the nurse was laughin'. You know how he is.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HARRY MCKNIGHT
turns.text: Find out who they are?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE NEAL DOMGAARD
turns.text: Nope, not yet. Their fingerprints don't match up anywhere.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HARRY MCKNIGHT
turns.text: Interesting.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE NEAL DOMGAARD
turns.text: Yeah ... and they both use the same address.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HARRY MCKNIGHT
turns.text: Where at?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE NEAL DOMGAARD
turns.text: Palmdale.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HARRY MCKNIGHT
turns.text: Damn, that's a long drive.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: So man, that's unheard of ... an accident like that ... who coulda foreseen that.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Unreal ... so, you're looking good. Whatcha doin' these days?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, not much Ed. Just doin' some stuff for this guy.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Making ends meet, huh.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Hardly.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah, look at my digs ... times are tough.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Oh, things aren't so bad. Gee, I hope you're not goin' to get in any trouble.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It was just a thing. The story made you laugh.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yeah, that's a funny story.

turns.speaker: LANEY
turns.text: Not here...no thanks.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Not a coke or anything?

turns.speaker: LANEY
turns.text: No ... thanks though... I'll take a cigarette if you have one.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Sure, reach in my shirt pocket there.

turns.speaker: LANEY
turns.text: No.  I haven't seen any.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: A brunette? ... maybe beat up?

turns.speaker: LANEY
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You'll keep your eyes open for me won't you baby?

turns.speaker: LANEY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: ANNOUNCER
turns.text: That's it folks for the Demon Boat Ride.... Everybody off. Watch your hands and feet.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Where's the dock ?

turns.speaker: ANNOUNCER
turns.text: And now ladies and gentlemen it's time for the fabulous CROCODILE SHOW !

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Great ! You couldn't be a fan of Dolphins or some other less threatening animal.

turns.speaker: ANNOUNCER
turns.text: So many tubes to get in, only one is the way out.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Great.. great. Is there any kind of hint or anything ?

turns.speaker: ANNOUNCER
turns.text: Pick with expediency !

turns.speaker: ANNOUNCER
turns.text: You must come in first place to move on !

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Jesus, my legs are asleep. I'll never be able to win this shit.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Is that it ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Yeah, I'd say that's it.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Doesn't it bother you to see this kind of brutal death ? I mean , I can understand the old man's infatuation with the stuff, but not you.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I'm an investment banker. I see blood bathes everyday. Besides, mine is not to question why, min is but to do or die.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: No one has a gun to your head.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Good morning. What do you have today ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I have an embezzler and his accomplice.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'll do the standard research and have them in by midnight, pending any unforseen problems.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Good. Nice to see you, Bruce. Johnny.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You have 43 unpaid parking tickets, sir. You have the right to remain silent, anything you say can & will be held.....

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: What's going on ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Please don't be alarmed, Ma'am.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Where are we ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: No time. Get him up.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Why should we trust you ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I made this place..... now listen to me. I'll get out of this room, we have bigger troubles than this....

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: What about Matt ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Leave him, he's dead.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: No !

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Why don't you tell us what the fuck is going on ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Why should I ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: You said we were criminals, what did you mean ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You're both embezzling. I saw the records.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Embezzling ? I'm not embezzling !

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Maybe not, but he is and fucking him makes you an accessory. He stole your passwords.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: I'm not fucking him..

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Now where do we go ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: How do we get out of this room ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: We wait. This is an elevator.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Now what the hell are we supposed to do ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: We have to climb up that.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: There's enough force to push you twenty feet in the air. It won't kill you, but it will hurt.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: You have issues. I mean you have some serious issues that need to be ironed out.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Come on, it works.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Give me a fucking.....

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: So where does this lead ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: No where. We've got about seven minutes before this thing slams into a concrete wall.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: So what do we do ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'm working on it.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Who the hell are you anyway ? What is this place ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It's called Murderland. It's paid for by First Bank.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: First Bank ? But how ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It's a tax write off for John C. McCay.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: McCay knows ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Knows ? He watches every "Guest" on tape. This whole place is here for his sick amusement. And no so are we.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What are you doing ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: I'm leaving.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Hey ! Hey ! I'm talking to you !

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: What ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You took an awful big risk back there.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Look I don't even wanna know how I got in this mess. I just want out. It has nothing to do with me.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: If you hadn't started boffing that weasel with an attitude, you wouldn't be here.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: I'M NOT BOFFING MATTHEW !

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Then you didn't give him any passwords of any kind ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: NO ! I wouldn't do that.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Then he isn't embezzling either is he ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Why would he ? His parents are rich.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: So you're telling me you were set up ? I knew something was wrong.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: I'm not listening.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Hey ! I'm still your best chance to get out of here alive.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: You've been doing a bang up job so far. Right now Matt is probably dead and it's your fault.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It won't take them that long to figure out we weren't on the train when it wrecked.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Not listening !

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Look, there's another train. They'll send it through here. You're fucked if you don't STOP and listen to me.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: I'm listening.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: At the subway station, we can get into a power duct that my little shit head of an assistant doesn't know about.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: What's the trick here ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: We drown.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Obviously, but what's the way out ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Once the room depletes it's oxygen, we have about 30 seconds, then a door opens on the bottom over there. Then we swim out.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: How long till the room fills ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'd say about thirty to forty minutes. Give or take a few.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: So why this ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Excuse me ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Why did you build this whole place ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Is this really the time ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Do you have something better to talk about ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I just graduated from M.I.T. in engineering. That's when John McCay hired me.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: He hired you to build this place ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I was hired in and started to do the boring old work routine. I was originally brought in as a technical advisor. First Bank had sponsored my scholarships.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I was lured by all the money and I truly did convince myself that what I did was for justice. Since then, McCay has wanted to put anyone he can down here.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: But how do you know if the people are guilty ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I do a very thorough background check. I go through police files, personel files, anything.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Then how come Matt and I showed up as guilty ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It was there, clear as day. I saw the computer records. Matthew has been fed wiring money to his personal account.  I just knew something was wrong.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: So you may have been duped this whole time. Killing innocent people, that must make you feel ..., how does it feel ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: There are other things too. They had everyone start taking those psych tests. Did they make you take one ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Yeah, everyone has to when they get hired.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: There's more to it than trying to see if you'd steal from the company or if you'd lie or cheat.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: What do you mean ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: McCay had a lot money done into researching psychological reactions to questions that are seemingly unrelated, but reveal everything. Like criminal impulses, homicidal impulses.....

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: And you believe that ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I've since changed my mind. I designed this place, based on my belief that I was doing what the legal system couldn't or wouldn't do. McCay had the company buy the property and they pay the bills. It's a tax write off. On the books everything looks kosher. I have an office on 5th that I haven't seen in ten years.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Doesn't anyone notice all the people missing ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: This is New York. No one notices anyone. Not even when someone disappears. At first it was the guy who was caught trying to steal McCay's Jag. Then it was dirty accountants that tried to walk away with millions. The Old Man got such a rush from it, I thought that he would start trying to send me people who used the copier after hours.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: How can you just take a life ? I mean it's a life, life is so precious.  How does it feel ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What do you do with the company, if I might ask ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: I'm in charge of the conversions.  When First Bank buys another smaller bank, I'm in charge of converting them to our systems and way of doing things.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You didn't think about it did you ? I read your file. It said you had a nervous breakdown.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: I wanted to let his family know....

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Know what ? That it was your fault ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: It wasn't my fault. I was just part of a team. I was doing my job...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: So was I. So don't give me any shit. Your business is just as bad. At least I'm up front about it. You kill people slowly. Your corporate take overs can decimate a families livelihood over a year sometimes two. Now you know how it feels.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Just remember, hold your breath as long as you can. Then go right over to that corner. The door will open and go in and up.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: You okay ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Fine...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: If we can get to through the next room, we'll be at a junction for a power grid.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: This is cute.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Yeah, real cute. The storm is fake, but the lightening is real.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Okay Mr Inventor, how do we avoid it ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You don't. It's random, there no trick.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Great...

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Where are we going ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: The Brooklyn Bridge.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: I don't get it.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It's poison gas, this is the antidote. Drink it.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Do you know where you're going ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: What was that ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Girder, watch your head.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: What about you ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: There's one more person here for me to visit.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Just stop it. End it here.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It'll end. It'll end with him and McCay. Then the park shuts down. Permanently.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: What are you DOING here ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I work here, remember ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: That was eleven years ago.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Well, surprise, surprise, I've been on the payroll for several years now. I still have an office and secretary. No one even batted an eyelash. Do you realize what the high turnover is in a multi corporation bank in New York ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Apparently pretty high, we just got a new CEO last week.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: That's a shame.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Yeah a real shame.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Well, I'll see you at the next staff party.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Bye....

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Are you Matthew Parker ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Yes, can I help you ? Maybe a donut or something ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: That's very funny, sir. You are under arrest.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Hey , Hey !

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Kojak here is arresting me for unpaid parking tickets.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: 43 unpaid parking tickets, sir.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: NO. Don't. You'll get a shock from hell if you touch that seat.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Who are you anyway ? What the hell is this ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Just shut the fuck up.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: OUCH !!! GODDAMMIT that hurts !!!!

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I told him not to sit down in there.....

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: NO ! Don't open ANY of them ! They're all wrong. Just wait.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Wait for what ? i don't wanna alarm you but we'll be the special at the International House of Pancakes in about five minutes !

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Trust me, if you open any door, you'll be dead a whole lot sooner.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Okay, NOW I'm worried. What exactly is on the other side of the door ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Either you'll be shot with bullets, impaled with a large spike, or nailed like a super model. Basically you're fucked any way you go.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: And that's different than this because...... ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Hey buddy, thanks for the help back there !

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I don't help criminals.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Give me one good reason why I don't plug you right here, right now ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Because of my charming personality ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Is it over ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Not quite....

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: That's nice.  I think I lost my wallet.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'd get out of the water if I were you.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Why ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: I thought you made this place ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I did, but this room has four exits and only one opens, it's up to them in the control room. There's one right over there. The exit light is on, but he can change it.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: What's next Walt ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: A dragon.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: So what happened ? Did you have a real bad theme park experience as a kid and this is your revenge ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Be very, very quiet...

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Are you hunting wabbits ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: The room has sound sensors. If you wake it up, it breathes fire.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: You were one of those guys that played Dungeons & Dragons with real swords, weren't you.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: An elevator ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Yeah, we're about a hundred an fifty feet below the subway stations. We're heading a little higher up now.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It's fine thanks.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Why don't you tell us a little about yourself ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Look pipsqueak, I'm having a real bad day here and we're just starting.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: That's not to tough.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Look...

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Issues ??? This guy has the damn subscription to every psychotic issue I've ever heard of.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: That's cute asshole.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Hey, try swimming. It works.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What the fuck are you talking about.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Swimming, you know, like in water, moron.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: You okay ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Ow...

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: This probably isn't the bet time, but I really have to pee. Can I pee ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Knock yourself out.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Thanks...

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Is it over ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Almost. Look, you two get out of here.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Where ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: In the jail cell is a spiral staircase. It leads to the surface. Take it all the way up.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: He's the liaison for McCay. Listen go. Go now.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Don't have to tell me twice.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I didn't think he'd make it past Scraps.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Let's just see if he can make it into round two....

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Don't.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Don't eat at the console.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What ? Are you my mother ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It's my control board and I don't want it acting squirrelly because you dropped a few crumbs into the keyboard, no put the shit away.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Yes, sir Mom.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Never underestimate a man who cheats on his taxes. His file says he is an avid jogger.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: You've got to be kidding me ! His lazy ass couldn't win the special Olympics.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: He'll never get it right. Try the Log Ride !

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: But, he's...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I said NO.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Stop the hydraulics.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Johnny, let's get the cleanup started.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: You've got it boss. One more mangled body to the East River, coming up !

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Hand me the 3/8ths.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Here. Am I ever going to get to run the controls for one these capers ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: When I think you're ready.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: When will that be ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: When you are ready.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Look, you're going to have to start trusting me sometime. I am a trustworthy person.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Trust is earned not given away.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: RESPECT is earned not given away, trust is given away to anybody.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Not down here. I'll start trusting you when I feel there the time is right. It's not personal, it's just survival.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I've been working with you for four years, don't you think that's worthy of at least one turn at the controls ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I made my bones on the street, you know. I did Riglioni in his own house. I was made in the Family, okay.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: And who bailed you out when a hit was put on you, you sorry sack of shit. Who put you up ? Who gave you a job ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: You did.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: That's right. Now who needs to trust who ? Trust me, when you're ready to work the controls, I'll put you in the hot seat.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What's wrong ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I just want to double check the facts.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I see here that this guy has made deposits into his own account for the last four months. Each one in the amount of $100,000. He then puts in deposits into his girlfriends account.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: So ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: He already had a balance of $600,000.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: He probably has a history of this shit.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Yeah, maybe.... Let's start the background checks. Let's see where they live and what kind of security systems....

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Matthew lives on the Upper West Side, kinda posh for a temp don't you think ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Any priors ? Any police record ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Checking..... Hah ! He has a shit load of unpaid parking tickets...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Parking tickets ? That's it ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Yeah, but we're talking 43.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: A real criminal.... I still think that's our in... What about her ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Checking........

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Why don't you just stop fucking around and just die !

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'm sick of playing. I've got a better idea.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: You think I'm that easy, Bitch ?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: For once in your life, shut the fuck up.

turns.speaker: FRED THOMISON
turns.text: Well ?

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Fire the whole division.

turns.speaker: FRED THOMISON
turns.text: Excuse me, sir ?

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Fire the whole division. We're moving more of the operations division into Manhattan anyway. Whoever is left over from the conversion is no longer needed. We already have all the key people here. Anyone else is expendable.

turns.speaker: FRED THOMISON
turns.text: Sir, I came from the Chicago offices myself, and if I may say, sir, there are still some very good....

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: If you want, I can fire you and have someone else who has the balls terminate these worthless people. Which will it be ?

turns.speaker: FRED THOMISON
turns.text: We will start work on it now sir.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Zachory ! My boy, how goes the carnage down on 44 ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Not that well sir. I believe we have a few too many soft hearts in the building. Did we aquire a bank from Chicago or a charity ?

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Relax, son. They'll learn in time that you don't fuck with First Bank. This is the real deal and we aim to keep it strong. My Daddy always told me that Only The Strong Survive.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I thought that was Darwin, sir. Or perhaps Nietzsche ?

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Perhaps it was. I was in boarding school for so many years, it's hard to remember. Do you have the tape of the latest exploits from my favorite hobby ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Yes sir, I do. Last night's, fresh from the Park.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: I have to say, that I am glad you are such an amazing kiss ass.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Thank you , sir. Sir, may I ask you a question ?

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: While I am not morally against these little, shall we say "hobbies", as long as I am on the payroll, but why not something like a yacht club ?

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Zach, how old are you, son ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I am thirty two.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: And how much do we pay you annually ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I make roughly four hundred thousand a year.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Zach my boy, I can spend your yearly salary in a blink. I have had that kind of money all of my life. If I wanted to, I could fly to Paris for the afternoon.  My father formed this company over seventy years ago. When my brother became mentally challenged, it was put in my charge. Now running a bank of this size is very stressful. I need to relax on what little down time I have. A yacht club will not quite make my blood pressure decline. Understand ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: I have entrusted you with a great many things. In your tenure with this company you have seen and heard things that could upset the very economic world in which we live. I think this kind of loyalty should be rewarded.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Thank you, sir. I was really hoping for shares, or possibly cash... but this, this is really personal.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Son, let's watch the tape.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: That was rather.... disappointing.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I had suggested that they tone down the program so that the "guests" might take longer to expire.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: I want more action. I want to see more ingenuity than that. I want to see the injured man out wit the machines !

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: But sir, most of the people we are putting into the "Park" are accountants that embezzle or investment bankers. They are not known for their physical or intellectual prowess.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: I don't believe Ol' Bruce is having as much fun with this as he once did. He still insists on the "guests" being of the more nefarious type.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: That's right, sir. He does a thorough background check and if he finds them to be criminal or guilty of embezzlement, then he will put them in the park. He has refused the last three suggested "guests".

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: What about that time when the mail room kid was accused of stealing and we put him in the "Park" ? Wasn't that a computer glitch ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Yes sir. It turns out we put an innocent man into the "park" and he was not the one who stole from the stamp machine. That is also about the time when Bruce began refusing.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: That mail room kid was the longest lasting "guest" yet ! Maybe we can alter the computer records and make another "guest" from the more athletic of our staff.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Bruce may still refuse. It is my belief that he is becoming more belligerent.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: I propose we consider a hostile take over. Perhaps Ol' Bruce is in need of a new job opportunity.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: What do you mean sir ?

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: What if we were to put Bruce into the Park as a Guest ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Sir ?

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: I'll bet that would be the Park run of the century !

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Sir, he created the Park. He would know how to circumvent any of the traps.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: I'm willing to bet that even the creator can't out wit his creation.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: What then sir ? What would we do with the park with out Bruce ?

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Do you think the assistant, what's his name...

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: John, sir.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Yes, do you think he would like a raise and a new position ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Sir, this is not like firing any employee. We can't predict what will happen.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: That my boy, is the best part. Life on top of the world is boring... predictable. If I wanted life without chances, I never would have paid for Murderland. Now go. Make a formal proposal and see about the assistant. Find out if it's viable.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Zachary.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Zach, my boy ! How is tonights adventure going ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Good, sir.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Is it as good as I hope it is ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Better, sir.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: One moment dear...

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Sir ?

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Not you Zach.  Remember, my wife is asleep upstairs, dear.  Zach, am I gonna like what I see on this tape ? Is it the grandest of all the Park's tapes ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Yes sir. It will be the best of your collection, I assure you.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Fantastic ! A little faster sweetheart.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Sir ? We're moving them right along as fast as we can.

turns.speaker: JOHN C. MCCAY
turns.text: Have that tape on my desk tomorrow morning.  First.... thing...

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: He has a phone pole sticking in his chest, I think we don't need an autopsy.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I'm just looking for our best interests. May I have the tapes, Bruce ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Hey, Mr. Executive. Buy you a drink sailor ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: We have new "guests" for the park. I have a file on them. May I see Bruce ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: He's been expecting you.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: No. I was just curious if what I heard about you is true ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What did you hear ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Only that you were one of the finest hit men in the mob. That if you wanted a good clean kill, that Johnny Tortelli was the man for the job.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I was.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Might I ask why you no longer work for the mob ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: There was a bit of confusion on one of my last jobs.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I thought, and correct me if I'm wrong, but weren't you trying to play both sides ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What are you looking for ? A blow job ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: No. I am not a homosexual.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Then what do you want ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Have you ever considered running your own "Park" ? I mean, since you will not be returning to your former profession.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I didn't think even this company could afford to write off enough to build a new "Park".

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: We can't.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Are you happy with your salary and position ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: No I am not.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I had hoped you would say that. I have a proposal for you.....

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I'm listening.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: So who are these people with the Boss ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Just a temp who pissed me off and a girl who turned me down for the night of her life.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Aren't you the bitter one.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: How long till the drug wears off ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: We should have another fifteen minutes at least.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Bruce has just awaken.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What ?????

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: What is Bruce doing ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I don't know.....
